newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian MinFins up on Dow, trend unclear.
newsitem.headline: Russian MinFins up on Dow, trend unclear.

text.p: Russian MinFins edged up on Tuesday in thin trading following a rise in the Dow Jones index and on market optimism about U.S. interest rates, dealers said.
They differed where the market would move in the next few days.
"The market edged up in the morning as no negative decision is expected at today's FOMC meeting," a Russian bank dealer said, estimating MinFins rose 0.3-0.4 basis points.
The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee meets at 1300 GMT to review monetary policy.
A Western bank dealer said the market nudged up following a rise in the Dow Jones index.
He forecast a price slip in the next few days.

"We shall fluctuate before the market finds a direction," he said. "But it is more likely to fall than to rise as now we are almost at all-time high. Besides, given the nervousness of global markets, clients are unlikely to take risks."
He also said that the Russian 10-year Eurobond was now more attractive than MinFins.
But the Russian dealer said the market would rise by at least 0.5 basis points on positive news likely to emerge from the FOMC meeting.
He said the market could not rise more than 100 basis points, where it would meet resistance, before the news about Russia's rating revision came.
He said tranche 5 rose most strongly as it has a higher yield but shorter maturity than tranche 7.
Tranche 5 has a 10.36 percent yield to maturity, tranche 7 10.33 percent, he said.
